core_claim: Hedy Lamarr, a glamorous 1940s Hollywood actress, secretly co-invented frequency hopping technology that became the foundation for modern WiFi, Bluetooth, and GPS systems.

supporting_details.recognition: Inducted into National Inventors Hall of Fame in 2014

source_citation: National Inventors Hall of Fame; US Patent and Trademark Office Records; Smithsonian Institution Archives
why_strange: A movie star with no formal engineering training invented technology that powers our wireless world decades before its time.

core_claim: Ching Shih, a former prostitute, became history's most successful pirate, commanding over 70,000 sailors and 1,800 ships in the early 1800s—a larger fleet than many national navies.

supporting_details.outcome: Negotiated amnesty with Chinese government, retired wealthy

source_citation: Murray, Dian H. (1987). 'Pirates of the South China Coast, 1790-1810', Stanford University Press; Royal Navy Museum Archives
why_strange: A woman rose from prostitution to command the largest pirate fleet in history, defeated multiple navies, and retired undefeated.

core_claim: Nikola Tesla's assistant, Kolman Czito, worked with the inventor for over 50 years yet remains virtually unknown despite helping build some of Tesla's most groundbreaking inventions.

supporting_details.contributions: Built Tesla's AC motors, wireless transmission devices, and Colorado Springs laboratory

source_citation: Tesla Memorial Society Archives; Seifer, Marc J. (1996). 'Wizard: The Life and Times of Nikola Tesla', Citadel Press
why_strange: The man who physically built many of history's most revolutionary inventions has been almost completely erased from technological history.

core_claim: Henrietta Lacks, who died in 1951, has technically saved millions of lives as her cancer cells (taken without consent) became the first immortal human cell line, enabling countless medical breakthroughs.

supporting_details.contributions: Enabled polio vaccine development, cancer research, gene mapping, COVID-19 research
supporting_details.cell_reproduction: Over 50 million metric tons of her cells have been grown

source_citation: Skloot, Rebecca (2010). 'The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks', Crown Publishing Group; National Institutes of Health HeLa Genome database
why_strange: A poor Black tobacco farmer's cells have been living and multiplying continuously for over 70 years, outliving her by decades and traveling to space.

core_claim: Mary Anning, a 19th-century fossil hunter with no formal education, discovered the first correctly identified ichthyosaur skeleton at age 12, revolutionizing paleontology.

supporting_details.impact: Her discoveries helped establish extinction as a scientific fact and influenced early evolutionary theory

source_citation: Emling, Shelley. 'The Fossil Hunter: Dinosaurs, Evolution, and the Woman Whose Discoveries Changed the World.' Palgrave Macmillan, 2009
why_strange: A working-class girl with no formal training made foundational contributions to science

core_claim: In 1944, Alice Coachman became the first Black woman of any nationality to win an Olympic gold medal, yet her achievement was largely ignored in segregated America.

supporting_details.event: High jump, winning height: 1.68 meters (5 feet 6 inches)
supporting_details.recognition: Received no invitation to the White House; honored by Coca-Cola years later

source_citation: Smithsonian National Museum of African American History and Culture; International Olympic Committee archives
why_strange: A historic Olympic first was virtually ignored due to racial discrimination

core_claim: Josephine Cochrane, a 19th-century socialite with no engineering background, invented the first commercially successful automatic dishwasher in 1886 after her servants kept chipping her fine china.

supporting_details.invention: Dishwasher using water pressure instead of scrubbers

source_citation: U.S. Patent Office; Lemelson-MIT Program; National Inventors Hall of Fame
why_strange: A woman in the 1800s revolutionized kitchen technology with no formal engineering training
